summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Boren Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from the connection with the existing sewer in Union Street to a connection with the existing sewer in the Pike Street, by constructing a sewer therein of proper dimensions, together with all necessary wyes, manholes, catch basins, lamp holes, flush tanks and other appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 28 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
